name: heat and power co-generation, oil | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17282/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity and district heat at a grid-connected oil power plant with a capacity of 500 MW. ;Emissions are in general calculated/estimated based on the fuel oil type S, European quality. This dataset has been built on the basis of oil electricity production datasets in version 2 of the ecoinvent database which were elaborated by N. Jungbluth 2007 (see main publication in modelling and administrative). The values and emissions are a weighted average of emissions in all datasets in version 2 (which are considered as the global values) multiplied with an efficiency scaling factor. The datasets in version 2 were valid for the following countries: AT, BE,  CS, CZ, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, GB, GR, HR, HU, IE, IT, NL, PT, SE, SI, SK. Weighting was made with electricity production data in those countries based on IEA/OECD 2012.   Nothing else than the efficiency has been adjusted in this dataset; besides that no new data collection has taken place;Comments:; - sulfur content of the oil is not adapted to local/average conditions.; - CO2 emissions are presented for the combustion and for the flue gas treatment; -  Extensive comments on emissions can be found in Jungbluth 2007, on which this dataset is based on.;Emissions to the water are from flue gas treatment. Most of these data come from two power plants in Portugal (EDP 2001) and data from Slowakia;EDP (2001) Environmental Report 2000. Electricidade de Portugal, S.A., Lisboa, PT, retrieved from: www.edp.pt.;Slovenské elektrárne (2002) Environment Report 2001, Bratislave, SK, retrieved from: www.seas.sk.;IEA/OECD. 2010. Electricity Information 2010. International Energy Agency (IEA), Paris Cedex (FR). Part IV. Detailed OECD Electricity And Heat Data.

From the constructed power plant ready to produce electricity and from the fuel ready to be used.

This activity ends with 1MJ of heavy fuel oil burned in power plant with heat and electricity as main products. 

This dataset includes all energy use, use of chemicals, emissions to air and water including treatment of flue gasses and effluents. In an oil power plant, water is needed for cooling, feed water for the steam circuit, for the flue gas treatment, or other cleaning. This dataset only considers water use (evaporation) for cooling and steam circuit.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2012.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Electricity and heat production in a conventional combined heat and power oil power plant with a capacity of 500 MWe
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The exchanges in this datasets are a weighted average of the following country oil datasets in the ecoinvent database (weighting with electricity production volumes in 2012):
AT, BE, BR, GR, CN, CS, CZ, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, GB, GR, HR, HU, IE, IT, JP, MK, NL, NO, PT, PL, SE, SI, SK Data are originally from sources from the 90ies. Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Net thermal efficiency based on the lower heating value (LHV). 
For all OECD countries, the IEA Electricity information 2014 provides data for the year 2012 on fuel input (TJ, Net calorific value NCV) and gross electricity production (GWh) as well as heat production (TJ) in tables 8 and 9 for each country for electricity only and Combined Heat and Power (CHP) plants each. Together with the information on own use (see parameter "losses"), the net electrical efficiency based on the NCV is calculated. 
For all non-OECD countries, data from the IEA Energy balances of non-OECD countries 2014 have been used. These tables do not always provide information on how much of the electricity has been produced in electricity only and in CHP plants, but often give the total value only. 

IEA. 2014. Electricity Information 2014. ISBN 978-92-64-21692-1. International Energy Agency (IEA), Paris Cedex (FR).
IEA/OECD. 2014. Energy balances of non-OECD countries 2014. International Energy Agency (IEA), Paris Cedex (FR).

exchanges.description:
Literature value/estimation. Estimation based on several literature sources:

Frischknecht R., Bollens U., Bosshart S., Ciot M., Ciseri L., Doka G., Dones R., Gantner U., Hischier R. and Martin A. (1996) Ökoinventare von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. 3. Gruppe Energie - Stoffe - Umwelt (ESU), Eidgenössische Technische Hochschule Zürich und Sektion Ganzheitliche Systemanalysen, Paul Scherrer Institut, Villigen, Bundesamt für Energie (Hrsg.), Bern, CH, retrieved from: www.energieforschung.ch.

Powergen (2001) Environment Report 2000. Powergen UK, Coventry, UK, retrieved from: www.pgen.com

ESB (1997) Environmental Review 1997. Electricity Supply Board, Dublin, IE, retrieved from: www.esb.ie

EDP (2001) Environmental Report 2000. Electricidade de Portugal, S.A., Lisboa, PT, retrieved from: www.edp.pt

IPPC (2001b) Integrated Pollution Prevention and Control (IPPC): Draft Reference Document on Best Available Techniques for Large Combustion Plants. European  Commission Directorate-General JRC, Joint Research Centre, Seville, Spain, retrieved from: http://eippcb.jrc.es.

exchanges.description:
Literature data, calculation, estimation. See tab 12.23 with element concentrations in dust (Pacyna 1982, Pacyna 1991); and tab. 12.24 with emission factors of heavy metals in fuel oil S (Richardson 1999, Powergen 2001).


J.M. Pacyna, "Estimation of Emission Factors of Trace Metals from Oil-Fired Power Plants", Norvegian Institute for Air Research (NILU), Lillestrøm 1982

J. Pacyna, "Trace Element Emissions from Coal-, and Oil- power Plants in Europe. Methodology of Calculations", Norvegian Institute for Air Research (NILU), Lillestrøm 1982

J.M. Pacyna, "Emission Factors of Atmospheric Cd, Pb and Zn for Major Source Categories in Europe in 1950 through 1985", Norvegian Institute for Air Research (NILU), Lillestrøm 1991

Richardson S. (1999) Atmospheric Emission Inventory Guidebook. Second Edition. EMEP: Co-operative Programme for Monitoring and Evaluation of the Long Range Transmission of Air Pollutants in Europe, CORINAIR: The Core Inventory of Air Emissions in Europe, EEA: European Environment Agency, Copenhagen, DK.

Powergen (2001) Environment Report 2000. Powergen UK, Coventry, UK, retrieved from: www.pgen.com.
